message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Help me to compile a complete list of U.S. Supreme Court justices who were successfully confirmed from President Richard Nixon’s first term through President Joe Biden’s term. For each justice, record:
Name, Position (Chief Justice or Associate Justice), Tenure Start Date(in the format as YYYY-MM-DD), Tenure End Date (enter “NA” for currently serving justices as of the end of 2024), Nominating President, President’s Party Affiliation, Ideological Leaning (Conservative or Liberal), Most Recent Prior Position

Please output the organized data in Markdown table format.
The column names in the table should be, in order:
Name | Position | Tenure Start Date | Tenure End Date | Nominating President | President’s Party | Ideological Leaning | Previous Position

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is: 
 ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
To compile this list, I need to gather information on each justice from Richard Nixon's first term to Joe Biden's term. I'll start with the most recent president and work backwards.
</think>

<search> Joe Biden Supreme Court nominations </search>

Search query: Joe Biden Supreme Court nominations
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Biden_Supreme_Court_candidates):
Joe Biden Supreme Court candidates - Wikipedia In February 2022, Biden selected Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to replace Justice Stephen Breyer, who retired at the end of the court's 2022 term.

[Doc 2](https://www.senate.gov/legislative/nominations/SupremeCourtNominations1789present.htm):
Supreme Court Nominations (1789-Present) - Senate.gov Since the Supreme Court was established in 1789, presidents have submitted 165 nominations for the Court, including those for chief justice. Of this total, 128 ...

[Doc 3](https://ballotpedia.org/Federal_judges_nominated_by_Joe_Biden):
Federal judges nominated by Joe Biden - Ballotpedia List of judicial nominees;; Supreme Court nominees appointed by Biden;; The number of historical judicial appointments made by presidents between 1933 and 2021; ...

Search query: Ketanji Brown Jackson nomination details
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ketanji_Brown_Jackson_Supreme_Court_nomination):
Ketanji Brown Jackson Supreme Court nomination On February 25, 2022, President Joe Biden announced that he would nominate Ketanji Brown Jackson to the position of associate justice of the Supreme Court of ...

[Doc 2](https://naacp.org/resources/historic-nomination-ketanji-brown-jackson-supreme-court):
The Historic Nomination of Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court On February 25, 2022, President Biden nominated Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson to be the 116th Associate Justice of the Supreme Court. She would be the first Black ...

[Doc 3](https://www.congress.gov/nomination/117th-congress/1783):
PN1783 — Ketanji Brown Jackson — Supreme Court of the United States ... 04/07/2022 - Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 134. Date Received from President. 02/28/2022 ...

From these searches, we know that Joe Biden nominated Ketanji Brown Jackson for the Supreme Court in February 2022, and she was confirmed on April 7, 2022.

Let's move back to previous presidents:

<search> Richard Nixon Supreme Court nominations </search>

Search query: Richard Nixon Supreme Court nominations
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Nixon_Supreme_Court_candidates):
Richard Nixon Supreme Court candidates - Wikipedia Warren E. Burger nomination · Harry Blackmun nomination · Lewis Powell and William Rehnquist nominations.

[Doc 2](https://www.nixonlibrary.gov/news/nixon-and-supreme-court):
Nixon and the Supreme Court | Richard Nixon Museum and Library Nixon's Nominations​​ Richard Nixon nominated six justices to the Supreme Court (four of which were confirmed by the Senate) during his ...

[Doc 3](https://www.senate.gov/legislative/nominations/SupremeCourtNominations1789present.htm):
Supreme Court Nominations (1789-Present) - Senate.gov President Nixon, Richard. Rehnquist, William H. Harlan, Oct 22, 1971, 68-26 No. 450, C, Dec 10, 1971. Powell, Lewis F., Jr. Black, Oct 22, 1971, 89-1 No. 439, C ...

From this information, we know Nixon's nominees included Rehnquist, Powell, Blackmun, and Burger, among others.
